title: GREGORSKI OUTDOORS: Area offers plenty of spots for foliage viewing, exercise
text:
Thursday, October 22, 2015 11:04 PM EDT 
GREGORSKI OUTDOORS: Area offers plenty of spots for foliage viewing, exercise BY ROBERT GREGORSKI REPUBLICAN-AMERICAN The foliage in western Connecticut is spetacular. It's an opportune time to be on hiking and walking trails and to be on inland waters. Paddling the Housatonic and Farmington Rivers can be eye pleasing. Check river conditions before you venture out.Here are some suggestions for a variety of short, medium and long hikes. There have been many times when family members and I decide to take a hike on the spur of a moment. Over the years, family members and I have spent time hiking the following trails, starting with the one we did last week.
